com.neebal.android.simplyreliable.message

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.neebal.android.simplyreliable.message.Message
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OutMessage

    public abstract class Message
extends Object
implements Serializable
    An abstract representation of a Message that can be sent to the server.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Neebal Technologies
    See Also:
    OutMessage, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SEND_EXEC_MODE_MESSAGE_DEPENDANCY
      the Message has a dependency on some other Message
      static int SEND_EXEC_MODE_PARALLEL
      the Message instances can be sent parallely
      static int SEND_EXEC_MODE_SEQUENTIAL_BY_TIME
      the Message is sent in the order of the message creation time
      static int STATE_DESTROYED
      The msg object is marked as destroyed and kept in the infrastructure until app reset
      static int STATE_EXECUTED
      state indicating that the entire response of this out message has been executed at the client side completely
      static int STATE_FORCED_WAIT
      the message has been received by the server but due to some reasons from the api caller side, the lifecycle of this message has still not reached the executed state.
      static int STATE_INIT
      the initial state when the message is just created
      static int STATE_READY_TO_BE_SENT
      The message is ready to be sent.
      static int STATE_RECEIVED_BY_SERVER
      The msg receipt has been acknowledge by server
      static int STATE_SCHEDULED_FOR_SERVER
      The msg has been scheduled for sending to the server.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Message()
      Builds new Message instance initializing the various attributes of it.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDependency(Message message)
      Adds a dependency in the list of dependencies of this Message instance In addition to setting the dependency in the dependency list, it will even set the sendAndExecMode of this Message instance to SendAndExecMode#MESSAGE_DEPENDANCY
      abstract void destroyMsg()
      Marks this Message instance as destroyed.

      • STATE_INIT

        public static final int STATE_INIT
        the initial state when the message is just created
        See Also:

      • STATE_READY_TO_BE_SENT

        public static final int STATE_READY_TO_BE_SENT
        The message is ready to be sent. The only reason it is not sent is for complying with the various rules defined in the design
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_SCHEDULED_FOR_SERVER

        public static final int STATE_SCHEDULED_FOR_SERVER
        The msg has been scheduled for sending to the server. This is a temporary state since it depends upon the present conditions of the infrastructure
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_RECEIVED_BY_SERVER

        public static final int STATE_RECEIVED_BY_SERVER
        The msg receipt has been acknowledge by server
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_FORCED_WAIT

        public static final int STATE_FORCED_WAIT
        the message has been received by the server but due to some reasons from the api caller side, the lifecycle of this message has still not reached the executed state. Reasons could be that after receiving the ok response, the api caller is waiting for some other processing to happen on that message( waiting for objects to be loaded), before the message can be deemed as executed
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_EXECUTED

        public static final int STATE_EXECUTED
        state indicating that the entire response of this out message has been executed at the client side completely
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_DESTROYED

        public static final int STATE_DESTROYED
        The msg object is marked as destroyed and kept in the infrastructure until app reset
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Message

        public Message()
        Builds new Message instance initializing the various attributes of it. By default the SendAndExecMode will be SendAndExecMode#PARALLEL

        public List<MessageDependency> getDependsOnMessageList()

      • isAllMsgDependencyFulfilled

        public boolean isAllMsgDependencyFulfilled()
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating whether all the dependencies of this Message instance have been fulfilled or no

      • doesDependOn

        public boolean doesDependOn(Message message)
        Parameters:
        message -
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating whether this Message instance depends upon the passed Message instance or no

      • recoverTransientProperties

        public void recoverTransientProperties()
        a method that will recover the various transient properties of this Message instance

      • addDependency

        public void addDependency(Message message)
        Adds a dependency in the list of dependencies of this Message instance In addition to setting the dependency in the dependency list, it will even set the sendAndExecMode of this Message instance to SendAndExecMode#MESSAGE_DEPENDANCY
        Parameters:
        message - the Message instance that the current instance depends upon
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the message instance passed to this method has not yet been sent to the SimplyReliable api infrastructure.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object object)

      • isValidCallback

        public abstract boolean isValidCallback(BaseCallback callback)
        Parameters:
        callback -
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating whether the passed callback is valid for this message instance or no

      • destroyMsg

        public abstract void destroyMsg()
        Marks this Message instance as destroyed. Depends upon the sub class implementations to override this method and give a meaningful destory semantics
